intro: Pimpinella prolifera, commonly known as the spreading cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Pimpinella prolifera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in woodland edges or grassy areas.
